1.text: Give the avocado a gentle squeeze to determine whether it’s ripe.

2.text: Cut the avocado in half lengthwise.

3.text: Remove the pit by whacking into it with your knife.

4.text: Cut the flesh of the avocado without piercing the skin for an easy dice.

5.text: Scoop the flesh out with a spoon if you’d like to slice or mash the avocado.

6.text: Mash it up for an avocado spread.

7.text: Mix in lime juice, onions, tomatoes, cilantro, and garlic for guacamole.

8.text: Blend a fresh avocado into a creamy salad dressing.

9.text: Slice or dice avocados to top a salad.

10.text: Roast avocado quarters for a warm, crispy addition to grain salads.

11.text: Grill avocado halves for a yummy taco filling.

12.text: Break eggs into avocado halves and bake them for a breakfast treat.

13.text: Make a creamy avocado pasta dish.

14.text: Blend avocado with frozen bananas and milk for a simple smoothie.

15.text: Add avocado to fruit smoothies to make them creamier.

16.text: Make a sweet, Indian-inspired avocado lassi.

17.text: Create a rich yet healthy chocolate avocado shake.

18.text: Cover the cut avocado with plastic wrap if you need to store it.

19.text: Save a mashed avocado by covering it with water.

20.text: Sprinkle your cut avocado with an acid to keep it longer.
